intro: Ptychosema stipulare, commonly known as the slender-stemmed ptychosema, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with unique floral structures. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered leaves. Its flowers are unisexual, with separate male and female parts, a common trait in the Euphorbiaceae family. Ptychosema stipulare typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest undergrowth.
